page.title: 08SCARCEWATER
page.content: Scarcewater is on the main road between Newquay and St Austell.It is dangerous through the hamlet as the road is rather narrow. There are about 20 houses which are very scattered. They house some old families and some young families. There are no shops or pubs. Basic needs can be satified at nearby St Stephens.There is an active Methodist chapel in the hamlet. Farming and china clay are the main jobs of the people. It is called Scarcewater because the area might have had a water stortage at one time. Families have lived here for ages as the houses are old. There is one telephone box and one post box. There is a small caravan club location with about 5 caravans in.We interviewed Mr Willcox who we found painting his house on our survey day.
